titles.title: To amend clause 2(g)(3) of House Rule XI to permit committee chairmen to schedule hearings.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Rules.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported by the Committee on Rules. H. Rept. 104-5.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 4.

action.text: Rules Committee Resolution H. Res. 47 Reported to House. Rule provides for consideration of H. Res. 43 with 1 hour of general debate. The resolution provides for the consideration of H. Res. 43 in the Committee of the Whole under an open rule. Bill is open to amendments.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered on the amendment and on the resolution without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
A similar measure H. Res. 47 was laid on the table without objection.

bill.summary: 1/31/1995--Passed House amended. Amends rule XI of the Rules of the House of Representatives to confer upon committee chairmen certain authorities currently relegated to committees regarding the announcement of committee hearings at least one week before commencement. Requires a committee chairman to make such announcement at the earliest possible date if he or she determines, with the concurrence of the ranking minority member, that there is good cause to begin the hearing sooner, or if the committee (with a quorum present) so determines by majority vote.
